place.name: BEAUCHAMP RODING
place.gazetteerText: ROOTHING-BEAUCHAMP, a parish in Ongar district, Essex; on the river Roding, 4½ miles N N E of Ongar r. station. It includes part of the hamlet of Birds-Green; and its post town is Ongar, under Brentwood. Acres, 1, 311. Real property, with the rest of Birds-Green, £1, 761. Pop., 226. Houses, 50. The property is divided among a few. The living is a rectory in the diocese of Rochester. Value, £244.* Patron, the Rev. W. Bond. The church is good. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
